result.execSummary:
The defendant Danielle L. Drinka was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Jail term is with huber privileges.

Submit an apology to victims in way and manner to be determined by agent. May have NO CONTACT with victims and avoid premises of businesses (Shear Elegance & Medford Coop). Submit DNA sample and pay for surcharge.

timeConds.notes: Jail term may be served in any county and is to commence within 30 days from 07-28-15.

records.addlTxt: If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.   DE must have completed bond form back to the Court within 7 days. Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.  NO CONTACT with Beth or Jason Hartmann nor their 3 children - (D.J.H., DOB 03-04-05; D.I.H., DOB 12-06-06; D.T.H., DOB 10-06-08).  May NOT go upon 1315 or 1319 Railroad Avenue, 624 Main St. or Morner Rd. - all located in Prentice, Wisconsin.  Defendant must reside in the home of her parents.  (both parents must cosign bond before modification takes place)
1:57 pm - Attorney James R. Lex appeared.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Request to modify bond by Attorney Lex. Court orders bond modified. Adj. 1:59 pm.
face sheet intake and investigation
Price County DNA Submission Form

11:37 am - Defendant Danielle L. Drinka appeared with attorney James R. Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA states agreement. Parties have received and waive reading of information. DE pleads NO CONTEST to charge.   Court questions DE regarding the plea.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC. DA certifies victims rights compliance. Comments by parties. Appeal rights given. Adj. 11:54 am. 
Court imposes:
Sentence withheld - 2 years probation.
Conditions:
$500 fine
$725.50 + 10% surcharge = $798.05 Restitution, Joint & Several
60 day jail term, with huber privileges, may be served in any county, to commence within 30 days from 07-28-15
Apology
No contact with victims and avoid premises of businesses (Shear Elegance & Medford Coop)
Obtain and maintain full time employment
Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.
